title: How to Quickly Repair an Underwire Bra

steps.headline: Grab a pair of sharp sewing scissors and moleskin.
steps.description: The moleskin will adhere to itself providing a soft cushion against the protruding underwire. Some stores and online sites sell moleskin bra fix adhesive patches which will work too. You can purchase moleskin at either a craft or fabric store. You will probably also find it at any store with a pharmacy. Look for it wherever the shoe pads are.

steps.headline: Cut a small section of moleskin to patch the hole.
steps.description: The smaller the patch, the better, as this help keep the repair looking seamless.

steps.headline: Firmly push the underwire back inside your bra.
steps.description: If possible, move the underwire away from the hole so you have only fabric in that area. Having fabric only will make it easier for you to repair.

steps.headline: Remove the backing from the moleskin patch.
steps.description: Press it against the hole on your bra. Smooth over the moleskin patch with your thumbs so it adheres in place.

steps.headline: Done.
steps.description: Your bra should be fixed for now; breathe easy and wear it again.
